captions.text: *funky hip hop beat*
Guarana Antartica
Brazillian Antartica y'know, practically the same place.
Smells like a weird diarrhea. Taste incredible. This is great.
I like it. I don't know what it is.
Man: This is delicious. Woman: I think it tastes like Red Bull.
Woman: I don't like it.  Man: I think it's great.
I bet native Antarticans are pissed that this soda exists.
Iron Bru?
I saw a lot of people excited about this in the comments last time.
It looks like you poured something new into this container.
It certainly doesn't look like something a silver man would drink.
Let me get a sip.
Ohhhhh snap!
I like this.
I would drink this all day.
And ten year old Kate would love this.
It also tastes like bubblegum.
But not good.
Bubblegum juice.
Rili.
Really?
Really!
Artic black taste?
This is going to blow your fuc**** mind. Tar tasting soft drink.
Woman: What?! Man: TAR?!
It smells like something that would drive a man to burn a town.
I think I might become evil after drinking this.
Oooof. What is... what is happening?
This tastes like you took a Coke and like poured it into a tire.
Why are you going for seconds?!
Chinotto.
Ooooh, this is a cute little bottle.
Well, this isn't in English.
Oh God. It has like a taste.
Man: Peel an orange and there's that like, white stuff on it. Woman: Yes! Hmm-hm.
It tastes like the white stuff!
You like this!?
Well, ye - it's just so strange.
Pakola.
It's got 10% our daily value of Vitamin C.
Uh oh.
Green?
I'm totally into it.
It's like a martian drink.
This looks like uh.. something that will turn me into a superhero.
It's cream soda plus Fruity Pebbles.
Oooh, that is a smell!
Yeah, I don't know if I have anything else to say about it, it's delicious.
It's like pretty high in the pleasing factor.
Yeah!
Come on, we need ten more comparisons.

comments.text:
Something I notice is most every American I've heard say Guaraná always 
pronounce it wrong. In Portuguese, when the letter R falls between two 
vowels, it becomes a soft sound; almost exactly like the short sound of the 
letter D. The little accent mark above the last A at the end is called the 
tilde and when you see an accent mark you almost always put the inflection 
on that syllable. So Guaraná is pronounced: gwah-da-nah﻿

comments.author: Asger Strandfelt

comments.text:
Guaraná in Brazil is the second most consumed soda after Coke. It's made of 
Guaraná fruit, which is mostly found in the Amazon forest. People often use 
Guaraná powder to make energy drinks, it works like caffeine. There's a 
brand called Guaraná Jesus, the juice is bright pink and so cute, like 
something Hello Kitty would drink (though it tastes a bit too sweet. I 
think it's mixed with strawberry flavor or something), you should google 
it!﻿

comments.text:
Trying to think of any English drinks made by our Irn Bru-loving southern 
cousins, I know Fanta is big south of the border but I heard that has it's 
origins in Germany, there's also Sprite (parodied in the GTA games. Sprite 
+ spunk), Tango, 7up (not seen that for years), Dr Pepper (though that 
looks to be American alongside the two big colas), Vimto and Tizer.  The 
last one is owned by the same folk as Irn Bru, but I think it may have 
originated in England.﻿
